title: Neighbours spoilers: Elly devastated as Shaun dies in avalanche?
text:
Is Elly about to lose someone else? (Picture: Channel 5)

Just as it seems Elly Conway (Jodi Anasta) is finally getting some happiness, she is on the brink of losing it all again in Neighbours.

Sparks flew between Elly and Shaun before he went away and she began to picture her future as a family with her unborn baby. But her perfect picture could be shattered when a natural disaster strikes.

Finn (Rob Mills) is excited for his brother’s return but he’s distracted when he and Bea (Bonnie Anderson) get into an argument over Scarlett (Christie Whelan Browne). He’s concerned she’s getting herself into a potentially dangerous situation, although neither of them realise just how dangerous Scarlett might be. They’re both hugely taken aback when, during their row, she accidentally calls him Patrick.

Shocked by the moment, Finn turns his attention back to his brother, putting the argument out of his head as he attempts to get in contact with Shaun (Brad Moller) to find out his plans to return. He’s worried when he struggles to get hold of his sibling, but he later gets a call that brings his world crashing down – there’s been an avalanche in Switzerland and Shaun is missing.

Finn immediately fears the worst while Elly surprises him by being hopeful. He becomes angry and resentful that she can’t face facts.

But her positivity is tested when three bodies are discovered and are unidentified. Finn is distraught and Elly is dealt a painful reality slap – is one of them Shaun?

Finn distracts himself with fears for his brother with Bea (Picture: Channel 5)

Elly refuses to believe he’s come to harm, which sees her and Finn come to verbal blows as he thinks she’s burying her head in the sand.

After chatting to Susan, Toadie decides to try and help, taking Elly for a chat. As they talk he gets to the bottom of why she remains so upbeat, she is clutching onto the dwindling hope that her baby isn’t about to grow up without a father.

Distraught, she and Finn find comfort with each other as they wait for news. Will Shaun make it out alive?

Scenes air from Monday 21st October at 1.45pm and 5.30pm on Channel 5.
